greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: row n gives denominators of Farey series of order n.
reference: J. H. Conway and R. K. Guy, The Book of Numbers, Copernicus Press, NY, 1996, p. 152
G. H. Hardy and E. M. Wright, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers. 3rd ed., Oxford Univ. Press, 1954, p. 23.
W. J. LeVeque, Topics in Number Theory. Addison-Wesley, Reading, MA, 2 vols., 1956, Vol. 1, p. 154.
A. O. Matveev, Farey Sequences, De Gruyter, 2017.
I. Niven and H. S. Zuckerman, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers. 2nd ed., Wiley, NY, 1966, p. 141.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10563
R. K. Guy, The strong law of small numbers, Amer. Math. Monthly 95 (1988), no. 8, 697-712. [Annotated scanned copy]
Andrey O. Matveev, Neighboring Fractions in Farey Subsequences, arXiv:0801.1981 [math.NT], 2008-2010.
N. J. A. Sloane, Stern-Brocot or Farey Tree
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Farey Sequence.
Index entries for sequences related to Stern's sequences
maple: Farey := proc(n) sort(convert(`union`({0},{seq(seq(m/k,m=1..k),k=1..n)}),list)) end: seq(denom(Farey(i)),i=1..5); # _Peter Luschny_, Apr 28 2009
mathematica: Farey[n_] := Union[ Flatten[ Join[{0}, Table[a/b, {b, n}, {a, b}]]]]; Flatten[ Table[ Denominator[ Farey[n]], {n, 9}]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 08 2004 *)
Table[Denominator[FareySequence[n]],{n,10}]//Flatten (* Requires Mathematica version 10 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 04 2016 *)
program: (PARI) row(n) = {vf = [0]; for (k=1, n, for (m=1, k, vf = concat(vf, m/k););); vf = vecsort(Set(vf)); for (i=1, #vf, print1(denominator(vf[i]), ", "));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 27 2014
xref: Row n has A005728(n) terms. - _Michel Marcus_, Jun 27 2014
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 08 2004
Changed offset (=order of first row) to 1 by _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 26 2009
